pair.Prompt: In October Term 1894, what was the dissenting opinion of Justice Harlan in United States v. E. C. Knight Co.?
pair.Response: Response: Justice Harlan's dissenting opinion in United States v. E. C. Knight Co. was that agreements in general restraint of trade are contrary to public policy, illegal and void. He cited Craft v McConoughy, People v. Chwago Gas Trust Co., India Bagging Association v Zock, and Santa Clara Lill & Lumber Co. v Hayes as examples of cases where courts have found agreements in restraint of trade to be illegal.
